curam.util.resources

Class Trace

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.resources.Trace

  • public final class Trace
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages debug tracing in the Curam server. By default tracing is off. You can set it through the environment to be on of
    • kTraceOff
    • kTraceOn
    • kTraceVerbose
    • kTraceUltraVerbose
    to control different levels of trace output. The verbosity of trace output relates to the ordinal position of the currently set traceLevel in this list.

    If you are writing code that performs tracing, use the {link atLeast method to check the level of tracing that is set. Obviously don't write any output if trace is off. You almost certainly shouldn't if trace is on either. Use the kTraceVerbose setting for most tracing, and kUltraVerbose for outrageously arcane stuff.

    The dump method is a convenience routine for dumping the contents of objects in general, but it performs specific formatting of Curam structs whose members are domain types.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Trace.CuramMethodInvocationHandler
      CuramMethodInvocationHandler is an interface that must be implemented by all method trace handlers.
      static class  Trace.CuramMethodInvocationHandlerDefault
      CuramMethodInvocationHandlerDefault is the default method trace handler for Curam.

    • Field Detail

      • kTraceOff

        public static final Trace kTraceOff
        Trace off. This indicates that no tracing should be performed.

      • kTraceOn

        public static final Trace kTraceOn
        Trace on. This indicates that a minimal level of tracing should be performed.

      • kTraceVerbose

        public static final Trace kTraceVerbose
        Verbose trace on. This indicates that a significant level of tracing should be performed.

      • kTraceUltraVerbose

        public static final Trace kTraceUltraVerbose
        Ultra verbose trace on. This indicates that arcane/area specific tracing should be performed, running at this trace level produces an extremely verbose log.

      • kDefaultTraceCategory

        public static final java.lang.String kDefaultTraceCategory
        This constant is used to name the top level of the hierarchy into which the general trace output is placed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • kTopLevelLogger

        public static final org.apache.logging.log4j.core.Logger kTopLevelLogger
        This constant is used as an alias for the top level curam logger in the hierarchy. This is constructed with a string parameter "Trace".

    • Method Detail

      • atLeast

        public static boolean atLeast(Trace traceLevel)
        Test for trace level.
        Parameters:
        traceLevel - The specified trace level.
        Returns:
        True if the current trace level is higher than or equal to the specified trace level in the following ordered list
        • kTraceOff
        • kTraceOn
        • kTraceVerbose
        • kTraceUltraVerbose
        and false otherwise.

      • tracingDynamicUIM

        public static boolean tracingDynamicUIM()
        Check if the tracing of rules dynamic Uim is enabled. This cannot be set directly, only through the application properties curam.trace.dynamic.uim .
        Returns:
        An indicator as to whether rules tracing is enabled.

      • tracingRules

        public static boolean tracingRules()
        Check if the tracing of rules invocation is enabled. This cannot be set directly, only through the application properties curam.trace.rules.
        Returns:
        An indicator as to whether rules tracing is enabled.

      • tracingSql

        public static boolean tracingSql()
        Check whether SQL commands should be traced. This cannot be set directly, only through the application properties curam.trace.sql.
        Returns:
        An indicator as to whether SQL tracing is enabled.

      • tracingSqlArgs

        public static boolean tracingSqlArgs()
        Check whether arguments to SQL commands should be traced. This cannot be set directly, only through the application properties curam.trace.sql_args.
        Returns:
        An indicator as to whether SQL argument tracing is enabled.

      • tracingServerCalls

        public static boolean tracingServerCalls()
        Check whether client/server calls should be traced. This cannot be set directly, only through the application properties curam.trace.servercalls
        Returns:
        An indicator as to whether client/server tracing is enabled.

      • tracingMethods

        public static boolean tracingMethods()
        Check whether entry/exit from business process and entity methods should be traced. This cannot be set directly, only through the application properties curam.trace.methods. A customer specific method handler can be provided by setting the curam.trace.method_handler application property to be the class name of the method handler. The class specified by this property must implement the CuramMethodInvocationHandler interface. If no customer specific method handler is specified then the CuramMethodInvocationHandlerDefault class is used.
        Returns:
        Server call Tracing indicator.

      • tracingMethodArgs

        public static boolean tracingMethodArgs()
        Check whether the arguments on entry/exit from business process and entity methods should be traced. This cannot be set directly, only through the application properties curam.trace.methods.args. A customer specific method handler can be provided by setting the curam.trace.method_handler application property to be the class name of the method handler. The class specified by this property must implement the CuramMethodInvocationHandler interface. If no customer specific method handler is specified then the CuramMethodInvocationHandlerDefault class is used.
        Returns:
        Server call Tracing indicator.

      • objectAsTraceString

        public static java.lang.String objectAsTraceString(java.lang.Object structure)
        Dump a struct to a string. This is used when producing a trace record.
        Parameters:
        structure - The structure that will be dumped.
        Returns:
        This string representation of the structure.

      • exceptionStackTraceAsString

        public static java.lang.String exceptionStackTraceAsString(java.lang.Throwable e)
        Obtain the stack trace of an exception as a string.
        Parameters:
        e - The exception whose stack trace should be obtained.
        Returns:
        The stack trace as a string.

      • getProxyObject

        public static java.lang.Object getProxyObject(java.lang.Object bizObject)
        Get a proxy object that delegates to the specified bizObject. The proxy performs tracing of invocations on bizObject methods and/or other processing. It may be an instance of the default trace handler provided by Curam, or of the class specified in curam.trace.method_handler.
        Parameters:
        bizObject - The business object for which the proxy is required, or possibly an existing proxy for a business object.
        Returns:
        A proxy object which implements all of the same interfaces which are implemented by the business object or, if a proxy was passed in, the same proxy which was passed in.

        public static org.apache.logging.log4j.core.Logger getLogger(java.lang.String category)
        Gets the Log4j logger for the specified category.
        Parameters:
        category - The name of the category for which the logger is required.
        Returns:
        A Log4j logger for the category.
